metadata.title: CVE-2019-14905 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A vulnerability was found in Ansible Engine versions 2.9.x before 2.9.3, 2.8.x before 2.8.8, 2.7.x before 2.7.16 and earlier, where in Ansible's nxos_file_copy module can be used to copy files to a flash or bootflash on NXOS devices. Malicious code could craft the filename parameter to perform OS command injections. This could result in a loss of confidentiality of the system among other issues.

criterions.comment: ansible package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9.4+dfsg-1').
